title: London/South Bank
name: The South Bank Lion
content: This statue was once the mascot of the Red Lion Brewery and stood on its roof until the brewery was demolished to make way for the Royal Festival Hall.  It was moved to Waterloo and then to its present position on the bridge.  Keen students of biology may notice that the statue is missing certain male body parts.  It was originally anatomically correct but was deemed too lewd and scandalous when placed closer to pedestrians' eye-level and was castrated so as not to cause offence. | image=Redlion.jpg
